objectives: Organize short ASL presentations using clear signposting (FIRST/NEXT/FINALLY)
Use time-first framing and anchor points for topics/sections

vocab.def: Signposts that structure a talk into sections.
Small pause + head shift + signpost to move sections.
Point to screen-space; show simple up/down trends.
Switch briefly to audience/questioner; return to neutral to answer.

sections.heading: Warm-Up: Signpost Flow

media.alt: FIRST â†’ NEXT â†’ FINALLY arrows
media.caption: Simple 3-part structure

sections.body: Drill a 3-part frame with **micro-pauses**: **FIRST TOPIC.** (pause) **NEXT EXAMPLE.** (pause) **FINALLY SUMMARY.** Keep each clause **3â€“5 signs**.

sections.body:
Example gloss:

â€¢ **NEXT EVENT LAST-WEEK SUCCESS.** (brief smile NMM)

sections.heading: Technique: Visual Anchors
sections.body: Reserve **screen-space** on your right for visuals (charts/images). Use **point** + brief **hold** to connect content. Keep trends simple: **UP (increase)** / **DOWN (decrease)** with NMM to match.

sections.heading: Q&A with RS
sections.body:
Practice quick exchanges:
â€¢ **RSâ†’AUDIENCE:** **QUESTION: WHEN FUNDRAISER?** (brows down)
â€¢ (neutral) **RSâ†’PRESENTER:** **NEXT-MONTH SATURDAY.** (neutral)
Always **return to neutral** between lines to keep roles clear.

sections.heading: Partner Practice: 3-Slide Talk
sections.body: Anchor three sections **left (FIRST)**, **center (NEXT)**, **right (FINALLY)**. A presents; B asks **1 Q** (RS). A answers, then **SUMMARY** close. Swap roles.

microCheck.q: What best marks a transition between sections?

sections.heading: Mini-Showcase
sections.body: Record **30â€“40s**: **FIRST/NEXT/FINALLY** structure, **one visual point**, **one Q&A RS**, and a **SUMMARY** line. Caption your three section labels.
